text: How can we get HubSpot sitemap in this format '<https://domainname.com/something/sitemap.xml>' ?

Hey <@U02BEMUMJTV>, have you looked at this article? <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/domains-and-urls/view-and-edit-your-HubSpot-hosted-domain-sitemap#edit-your-sitemap|https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/domains-and-urls/view-and-edit-your-HubSpot-hosted-domain-sitemap#edit-your-sitemap>

Sorry if this has been asked before, but can't seem to find the solution. I need to get the value from a drop down in a personalization token for an email - its currently only returning the field label. For example, we have a drop down field with countries i.e.
Label - Mexico, Value: mexico
Label - US, Value: unitedstates
Label - El Salvador, Value: elsalvador
Laebl - Brazil, Value: latam
Hey Kyle, have you tried previewing the email as a contact instead of the web version preview? That should show the actual value
yeah, I think the issue is actually there is a "." in the value so this might be a moot point
Here's the example. The personalization token is pulling the Label, not the Value
